so_47857402: $ echo "hello world" > NAME
$ sudo cp -a NAME /mnt/fd
$ ls -l /mnt/fd
total 1
-rwxr-xr-x  1 root root   12 Dec 17 13:55 NAME
$ cat /mnt/fd/NAME
hello world

$ perl x &
[1] 16439
$ rm x
$ readlink /proc/16439/exe
/usr/bin/perl

0  1  2

Top-3 Similar Questions: ul_304120: How to recover a deleted folder full of files managed by dpkg?
au_271659: How do I recover deleted entries from Xubuntu Settings Manager?
au_493637: How can I recover from deleting the /usr/share/themes directory?
Top-3 Scripts:
ul_304120: for pkg in $(dpkg --get-selections | awk '$2=="install" { print $1}')
do
  f=$(dpkg -L $pkg | grep /usr/share/man)
  if [ -n "$f" ]
  then
    echo $pkg has files in /usr/share/man
  fi
done

/var/lib/dpkg/info/$pkg.info
